title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
6 points maximum
One point for each of the following explanations/identifications:

· Conversion of light (or inorganic chemical) energy to cellular chemical energy

· Explanation that conversion is the result of photosynthesis or chemoautotrophy

· Concept that energy moves from one trophic level to another

· Understanding that there is a dramatic decrease in the amount of energy transferred from one trophic level to the next

· Energy loss is the result of metabolic activity/heat loss from one trophic level to the next

· Explanation of the concept of primary productivity

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
6 points maximum
One point for each of the following explanations/identifications:

Deforestation (3 points)

Impact

· Loss of energy

· Removal of primary producers

· Destruction of habitat decreases food supply

· Disruption of ecosystem

· Natural succession—NO change in energy flow

· Clear-cutting for agriculture increases primary productivity

· Clear-cutting for development decreases primary productivity

Global climate change (3 points)

Definition

· Alternation of climate/global warming or cooling
Impact

· Increase or decrease in numbers of producers

· Increase or decrease in energy

· Increase or decrease in metabolism/energy

· Changes in respiratory heat depending on the ecosystem

· Replacement of productive ecosystems with less productive ones (desertification, tundrification)
